title: Non-clairvoyant Scheduling with Partial Predictions
abstract: arXiv:2405.01013v2 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: The non-clairvoyant scheduling problem has gained new interest within learning-augmented algorithms, where the decision-maker is equipped with predictions without any quality guarantees. In practical settings, access to predictions may be reduced to specific instances, due to cost or data limitations. Our investigation focuses on scenarios where predictions for only $B$ job sizes out of $n$ are available to the algorithm. We first establish near-optimal lower bounds and algorithms in the case of perfect predictions. Subsequently, we present a learning-augmented algorithm satisfying the robustness, consistency, and smoothness criteria, and revealing a novel tradeoff between consistency and smoothness inherent in the scenario with a restricted number of predictions.

tldr: 该文章聚焦于非先知型调度问题中的预测不完全性场景，研究了当决策者仅能获得部分任务大小的预测信息时，如何设计高效的算法。文中首先在完美预测的情况下建立了近最优的边界和算法，然后提出了一种学习增强算法，该算法满足鲁棒性、一致性和平滑性的要求，并揭示了在预测有限的场景下一致性和平滑性之间的一个新的权衡关系。
